comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: Posed shot of an array of eight A-3 Skywarrior used by the then Naval Missile Center. Fair quality copy. Details lost. Date unknown. In front is NRA-3B Skywarrior 144834 Modex 79 with NMC logo on tail. From left to right; 1. Heavily modified A-3 with cable ducting along front fuselage and ram air turbine below. ….Perhaps modified nose. 2. Possible NMC KA-3B 3. NMC A-3B. Perhaps modified nose. 4. Possible NMC NRA-3B 5. NMC NRA-3B. Perhaps modified nose. 6. NMC NRA-3B 7. NMC A-3A or UA-3B In far distance are a group of P-2 Neptune aircraft. As many as six RA-3Bs were modified as NRA-3Bs for use for various test purposes. One NRA-3B (144834) was again modified to be the sole TNRA-3B as a two-seat training aircraft. However, dual controls were not actually fitted before the aircraft was delivered. 144843 was bailed to Raytheon and used for tests and evaluation during the Patriot surface-to-air missile program. www.joebaugher.com/usattack/newa3_5.html NAVAL MISSILE CENTER/PACIFIC MISSILE TEST CENTER (NMC/PMTC) During 1959, the U.S. Naval Missile Center at NAS Point Mugu, California, received its first two A3D-1s. From then PACMISTESTCEN operated highly modified Skywarriors (NA-3A, NA-3B, NRA-3B, and NTA-3B) to support several activities, including captive flight testing of missile weapon systems, test and evaluation of electronic warfare components and systems, and electronic warfare exercises for the Fleet. a3skywarrior.com/index.php?nid=105917&s=rs&grpid=... The following airframes were known to be used by the NMC/PMTC; A-3A 135418 NA-3B 138938 KA-3B 138944 RA-3B 142667 RA-3B 144825 RA-3B 144833 RA-3B 144834 RA-3B 144840 From a webpage of fifteen pictures these seven depict Skywarriors from the NMC/PMTC: www.aircraftprofiles.dk/?page_id=444&album=31&gal... A-3A 135418. Modex 70 Naval Missile Center (NMC) NAS Point Mugu. Nov. 23 1972. KA-3B 138944 Modex 73 Naval Missile Center (NMC) Jan 1973 NA-3B 138938 Modex 74 Pacific Missile Test Center (PMTC) Aug. 1979. NA-3B 138938 Modex 74 Pacific Missile Test Center (PMTC) NAS Point Mugu Dec 1985. NRA-3B 142667 Modex 71 Pacific Missile Test Center (PMTC) May 1981. NRA-3B 142667 Modex 71 Pacific Missile Test Center (PMTC) NAS Point Mugu Nov 1989. NRA-3B 142667 Modex 71 Pacific Missile Test Center (PMTC) Nov. 1990. (All Photos Credit to Paul Minert Collection) [Courtesy AIRCRAFTPROFILES.DK] Two 'flickr' pics of PMTC NRA-3B 144825: www.flickr.com/photos/rv8tor/4807907448/ www.flickr.com/photos/rv8tor/4807284479/ NRA-3B 144825 PMTC Modex 75 Go to these four other 'flickr' pics for more PMTC NRA-3B’s: www.flickr.com/photos/rv8tor/4807906582/ www.flickr.com/photos/rv8tor/4807907646/ www.flickr.com/photos/rv8tor/4807283967/ NRA-3B 144833 PMTC Modex 73 Other pictures of NRA-3B 144833 with PMTC www.vpnavy.com/misc_04/pmtc_01_10may2002.jpg Pacific Missile Test Center (PMTC) RA-3B "Skywarrior" (BuNo 144833) in-flight, date unknown. www.chinalakealumni.org/IMAGES/1982/144833%20KA-3B%2018OC... KA-3B Skywarrior BuNo 144833. # 73. 18 October 1982. Pt Mugu. Photo by Bob Niedermeier Picture of flypast with NRA-3B 144833, NA-3B 138938 & NRA-3B 144825 of PMTC www.air-and-space.com/skywarrior/821017bl.jpg Pacific Missile Test Center trio: NRA-3B 144833 is joined by NRA-3B 144825 BH75 and NA-3B 138938 BH74 at the Pt. Mugu airshow on October 17, 1982. The modified nose of 144825 was later replaced with the standard RA-3B nose from 144833. Picture definitely of NRA-3B 144825 with PMTC: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:NRA-3B_PTMC_DN-SC-83-05204.JPEG This NRA-3B aircraft is actually operated by Raytheon Flight Test Services out of Van Nuys airport, CA as N578HA, Buno 144825. It had the "Snoopy nose" radome removed and replaced with a conventional A-3 radome. UA-3B Skywarrior. Bu No 144834: commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Douglas_UA-3B_VQ-2_NAN11-... Poor quality photo of the single Douglas UA-3B Skywarrior. Bu No 144834, delivered to U.S. Navy as RA-3B. Later converted for use at Pacific Missile Test Center (PTMC) at Point Mugu, California (USA). Designated NRA-3B and later TNRA-3B. Final designation was UA-3B and served with VQ-2 and electronic warfare squadron VAQ-34. (shown here) Retired August 1990. Hasegawa 1/72 scale model of a KA-3B 138944 of the Naval Missile Center: www.flevoaviationhobby.net/images/kitreviews/1-72/has155/... (click on box cover for picture) Go to this 'flickr' pic for an RA-3B: www.flickr.com/photos/runway27r/2876163804/ Douglas RA-3B 144832 Modex 7.
